content:
ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager Class

Definition

Manages serialization of activities into designer-generated source code segments before compilation.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public class ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager : IServiceProvider, System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager
Inheritance
Object
ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

Constructors

ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager(IDesignerSerializationManager)

Initializes a new instance of the ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager class.

public ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager (System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager manager);
Parameters
manager
IDesignerSerializationManager

The IDesignerSerializationManager to associate with this instance.

Properties

Context

Gets the ContextStack associated with ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager.

public System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ContextStack Context { get; }
Value
ContextStack

The ContextStack associated with the ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager.

Remarks

Use Context to provide information to a nested ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager.

Properties

Gets a PropertyDescriptorCollection that contains a read-only collection of type PropertyDescriptor.

public System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection Properties { get; }
Value
PropertyDescriptorCollection

A PropertyDescriptorCollection that contains a read-only collection of type PropertyDescriptor.

Remarks

Using the properties available in the PropertyDescriptorCollection class, you can query Properties about its contents. Use the Count property to determine the number of elements in the collection. Use the Item property to obtain a specific property by index number or by name.

In addition to properties, you can use the Find method to obtain a description of the property that uses the specified name from the collection.

SerializationManager

Gets the IDesignerSerializationManager associated with the ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager.

protected System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager SerializationManager { get; set; }
Value
IDesignerSerializationManager

The IDesignerSerializationManager associated with the ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager.

Remarks

Gets a stack-based, user-defined storage area that is useful for communication between nested serialization objects.

Methods

AddSerializationProvider(IDesignerSerializationProvider)

Adds the specified serialization provider to the serialization manager.

public void AddSerializationProvider (System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider provider);
Parameters
provider
IDesignerSerializationProvider

The IDesignerSerializationProvider to be added.

CreateInstance(Type, ICollection, String, Boolean)

Creates an instance of the specified type and adds it to a collection of named instances.

public object CreateInstance (Type type, System.Collections.ICollection arguments, string name, bool addToContainer);
Parameters
type
Type

The data Type to create.

arguments
ICollection

An ICollection of arguments to pass to the constructor for the specified type.

name
String

The name assigned to the resulting object. This name can be used to access the object later through stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager.GetInstance*.

If null is passed, the object is created but cannot be accessed by name.

addToContainer
Boolean

true to add the object to the design container; otherwise, false.

The object must implement IComponent for this to have any effect.

Returns
Object

The newly created object instance.

Remarks

This provides an indirect reference to the SerializationManager method of the same name.

GetInstance(String)

Gets an Object of the specified name, or null if that Object does not exist.

public object GetInstance (string name);
Parameters
name
String

The name of the Object to obtain.

Returns
Object

An Object of the specified name, or null if that Object does not exist.

Remarks

This provides an indirect reference to the SerializationManager method of the same name.

GetName(Object)

Gets the name of the specified Object, or null if the Object has no name.

public string GetName (object value);
Parameters
value
Object

The Object to obtain the name for.

Returns
String

A String that contains the name of the Object.

Remarks

If the object is not an activity the corresponding method of the WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager is called.

If the activity has no parent, then the activity qualified ID is returned with any periods (.) replaced by underscores (_).

GetSerializer(Type, Type)

Gets a serializer of the requested type for the specified Object type.

public object GetSerializer (Type objectType, Type serializerType);
Parameters
objectType
Type

The Type of the Object for which to obtain the serializer.

serializerType
Type

The Type of serializer to retrieve.

Returns
Object

A serializer of the requested type for the specified Object type.

Remarks

If the object type is a string, a default serializer is returned. Otherwise the corresponding method of the SerializationManager is invoked.

GetService(Type)

Gets an Object that provides a service of the specified Type.

public object GetService (Type serviceType);
Parameters
serviceType
Type

The Type of service to be provided.

Returns
Object

A Object that provides a service of the specified Type.

GetType(String)

Gets a Type of the specified name.

public Type GetType (string typeName);
Parameters
typeName
String

The fully qualified name of the Type to load.

Returns
Type

An instance of the Type, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the Type cannot be loaded.

Remarks

This version of GetType provides an indirect reference to the SerializationManager property of the same name.

RemoveSerializationProvider(IDesignerSerializationProvider)

Removes a custom serialization provider from the serialization manager.

public void RemoveSerializationProvider (System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider provider);
Parameters
provider
IDesignerSerializationProvider

The provider to remove.

Remarks

provider must have been added using AddSerializationProvider.

RemoveSerializationProvider provides an indirect reference to the SerializationManager property of the same name.

ReportError(Object)

Reports an error in serialization.

public void ReportError (object errorInformation);
Parameters
errorInformation
Object

An Object that contains the error to report.

Remarks

errorInformation can be of any object type. If the object is an exception, the message of the exception is extracted and reported to the user. If the object is any other type, ToString

is called to display the information to the user.

ReportError provides an indirect reference to the SerializationManager method of the same name.

SetName(Object, String)

Sets the name of the specified existing Object.

public void SetName (object instance, string name);
Parameters
instance
Object

The Object instance to name.

name
String

A String that contains the name to give the instance.

Remarks

SetName provides an indirect reference to the SerializationManager method of the same name.

An exception is thrown if you try to rename an existing object or if you try to give a new object a name that is already taken. In addition, an exception is thrown if you do not pass in an existing object to the method.

Events

ResolveName

Occurs when stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.ActivityCodeDomSerializationManager.GetName* cannot locate the specified name in the serialization manager name table.

public event System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ResolveNameEventHandler ResolveName;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

SerializationComplete

Occurs when serialization is complete.

public event EventHandler SerializationComplete;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see NIB: Consuming Events.
